title: DJ Sona music extremely quiet
body:
I don't have the best hearing so that's what I thought the issue was... but then when I was actually playing, the other spell effects and such drowned out the music almost entirely.  I tried turning my in-game music to 100 and it was still incredibly difficult to hear.  I don't know if this is a bug or intended but I'm starting to regret my purchase.  The music was a huge part of the reason I bought the skin and I can barely hear it... 

I tried checking in the options for a DJ Sona specific volume bar but there doesn't appear to be one... 

Is there a problem with DJ Sona's music volume?  I would've thought I could hear it more clearly with the music setting adjusted to 100.

replies.body:
Hey Crunkberri,

DJ Sona's music is intentionally not loud because we didn't want it to interfere with gameplay. It's meant to be similar to the ambient music that you normally hear on Summoner's Rift. 

If the music was loud, it would take away from some of the other audio cues that you might hear, such as Varus charging his Q or Sion ulting.

Yea.. and that's what one of the other posters was saying... I second AtrocityEyes's response.  I can still hear other game sounds perfectly.. the music is too low.  Is there any chance of giving us an option specific to her skin allowing us to listen to it at a non-ambient level.. 

I also feel like the volume is subpar even for ambient music.
There currently isn't a plan to change how DJ Sona's music functions, but I can relay this feedback back to the team.

Here's my problem with this.  I bought the skin to listen to the music.  I was promised I would be able to hear the music.  I can barely hear it if I'm in a Skype call with friends playing the game.  That's a problem.  There should be an option to turn the music up.  "But you can't hear other in game sounds!"  I don't care.  I'm the one buying the skin.  Let me turn the music up for myself.  If it causes problems, I can turn it down.  But why are you making me get a product I can't hear because some people might have clarity issues with it?  This is supposed to be an ULTIMATE skin.  I should be able to hear it.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QpWLlspa,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2015-02-25T22:45:10.573+0000)
>
> There currently isn't a plan to change how DJ Sona's music functions, but I can relay this feedback back to the team.

It is significantly quieter than the normal background music at the same volume settings.  To hear it at a normal level I had to turn my volume up 30% and turn the sound effects back down the the level they were before.

Okay!  Awesome!  Overall, I like the skin as a skin.  It looks great visually.  But the only reason I was willing to pay the ultimate skin price was for the music aspect of it.  Hopefully more people who are having the same experience as me speak up.  Maybe the team will be more motivated to add a DJ Sona volume option for those of us who's primary pull towards that excess of RP was for the music aspect of it if they see there's high demand for a way to further increase its volume.

Please go to the page where you guys advertised the skin and listen to the tracks in the abilities area.

http://promo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/dj-sona/

The songs are advertised as being much louder than they actually are.  It's really annoying because that page got my hopes up so much... then when I was playing the skin in the game, I thought the music wasn't working at first.. until it started to slowly move up to quiet.... 

If the music is supposed to be quieter in game, you need to correct the advertisement to match.  From my perspective, I just got falsely advertised.

Riot: "Listen to these jamming beats!  This is what you get to listen to while playing this new skin!"
Me: "Cool!"
Me: /buy skin
Me: /play game with skin
Me: "Something's wrong with my DJ Sona music.. I can barely hear it.. how do I get it to match the advertisement's volume?"
Riot: "You don't.  It would be disruptive if the music was as loud as advertised."

See my point?  You're not selling the product you advertised...

(Please don't take it personally that I keep saying "You".  I'm aware you specifically are likely not responsible for this situation.  But at the moment, you are representing Riot so you get to take the hits for them.)
Just how badly has everybody blasted their ears out? It's plenty loud for me.

For me, the music isn't playing at all. I get the default background music when i play on the same team with someone who has the skin. THIS i do know is a bug. Not even the option to mute her music is there anymore like it was in PBE

Hiya Zamrayz,

You'll need to opt into the music experience by holding tab, and clicking on the music icon button. I've attached a photo of where it's located. Are you still not seeing it?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QpWLlspa,comment-id=000300040000,timestamp=2015-02-25T23:19:15.639+0000)
>
> Hiya Zamrayz,
> 
> You'll need to opt into the music experience by holding tab, and clicking on the music icon button. I've attached a photo of where it's located. Are you still not seeing it?

So, this post, in general discussion has been up for 3 hours and you've commented 3 times on it.
While this post http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/OLKUz06A-gameplay-master-yis-alpha-strike-against-baron-and-dragon-is-severely-bugged-repost-with-video and this post http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/EEOM2xTA-gameplay-flaw-with-master-yi-against-baron-and-dragon have been up for 6 days with no response. Once again, thank Katey for intentionally skipping over my posts even when I have a legitimate bug report with video and detailed description of the issue.

Hey TornVenom,

I'm not ignoring your posts. 

I respond to reports in relation to skins because that's the content I work on. We have other teams who are looking into other issues that are reported. Although there may not be a red post on every bug report, we are reading them and investigating.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QpWLlspa,comment-id=00030004000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-25T23:33:44.431+0000)
>
> Hey TornVenom,
> 
> I'm not ignoring your posts. 
> 
> I respond to reports in relation to skins because that's the content I work on. We have other teams who are looking into other issues that are reported. Although there may not be a red post on every bug report, we are reading them and investigating.

Well, I've tried getting the attention of riot on this for 6 days, I've cross posted in GD, the reddit page, tagged League of Legends on twitter and even deleted the first post and redid this whole thing with a video to prove that it was happening... still nothing. I'll thank you for your quick response this time Katey, It's just you seem to be the one to post the most in RAB so it made me think you were the go to person about bugs.
I've gone ahead and forwarded it to the proper team to ensure they see it.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QpWLlspa,comment-id=0003000400000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-26T00:14:33.488+0000)
>
> I've gone ahead and forwarded it to the proper team to ensure they see it.

Thank you.

> [{quoted}](name=TornVenom,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QpWLlspa,comment-id=0003000400000000,timestamp=2015-02-25T23:30:18.966+0000)
>
> So, this post, in general discussion has been up for 3 hours and you've commented 3 times on it.
> While this post http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/OLKUz06A-gameplay-master-yis-alpha-strike-against-baron-and-dragon-is-severely-bugged-repost-with-video and this post http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/EEOM2xTA-gameplay-flaw-with-master-yi-against-baron-and-dragon have been up for 6 days with no response. Once again, thank Katey for intentionally skipping over my posts even when I have a legitimate bug report with video and detailed description of the issue.

Well... I can take a guess at that... The bug posts in GD thread aren't in the right spot.  I don't go to GD threads to research bugs to watch out for so why would they?  If you posted those.. try posting them in the appropriate channels in the future and then maybe you'll get the attention needed to resolve the issue.

That'd be like me getting mad at a Blizzard for not answering a WoW thread I posted in the D3 forums... Just.. think about it.. lol

Hi have the same issue as the OP i can barely even hear the music to the point where i actually have to turn everything else in the game down very low to hear it. I dont think its supposed to be as low as it is because even with my headphones volume turned all the way up and every other volume turned down i have to really really listen to hear the music.
I just bought the skin and played a game. I honestly thought there WAS no in-game music for her, as I didn't hear anything while playing. Looks nice, though. Would be nice to hear some music.

Hey Kipster,

Do you have your music slider turned up in the audio options? 

I know a lot of people have the in-game music turned off because they have Pandora or the like when they play.
Mine is on max, cant hear the music.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QpWLlspa,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-02-25T21:51:44.586+0000)
>
> Hey Crunkberri,
> 
> DJ Sona's music is intentionally not loud because we didn't want it to interfere with gameplay. It's meant to be similar to the ambient music that you normally hear on Summoner's Rift. 
> 
> If the music was loud, it would take away from some of the other audio cues that you might hear, such as Varus charging his Q or Sion ulting.

Can we have the option to make it louder? I mean, casually, I could care less, I already listen to music while I'm playing. Of course if you're playing competitively, you probably wouldn't want to be distracted, and would turn down Sona's music anyway. Win-win?
Go to game options, it lets you adjust a bunch of audio (sfx, music, announcer, etc). That's always been an option.

That's the thing, people are doing that and it's still quiet, Riot says it shouldn't be loud bc it would be disruptive. (He used Sion's ult shout as an example.. if music too loud, you wont hear Sion's shout.)

The complaint is.. some people want it louder.. so we're asking for the option.  It was advertised to us as being louder than it actually is.  We want what we were lead to believe we were buying.
I turned everything else down much lower, then turned my computer volume up. It sounds fine.
But there is no slider for ability sounds.
Friendly reminder that if you have to put people down for investing in things they enjoy, you're a fucking idiot.
Then I take it you're enjoying your 3 minutes of dialogue and music that's hard to hear?

For the most part.. yes.  Just wish it wasn't hard to hear.  The songs are awesome and I feel like they did a fantastic job for the most part.  I just want what I was lead to believe I was buying.

I mean seriously.  Go to the page they advertised it on.  http://promo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/dj-sona/

Now go listen to the music in the little abilities box.  THE MUSIC IS SO LOUD!  But then I got the skin in game and it was so insanely quiet... I'm going to re-link this in a response to the Riot employee too so he can see why I feel mislead.

Come on guys, let's not turn this post into a flame war.  I made the post with legitimate concern for my investment.  I know for a lot of people it's not that big of a deal to buy skins like this.. but I don't make a lot of extra money.  I tend to spend it on things I truly enjoy/want.  It doesn't make me an idiot to want this skin.  It's a really cool concept and looks good in-game.  I just wish Sona wanted to raise the roof.. instead of inflict naps.  More volume would be great. :D

Hopefully Riot hears our concerns and works with us to make sure we got what we were sold.. at the moment, I feel like advertised one thing and sold me another.  It doesn't feel good.

Yes sir boss man!

I do hope they hear our concerns and perhaps make a change.  It's hard not to bring money into this, but real talk $20 each with a game base that has what...a couple million players? They are probably pulling in more than I-would-like to-know from this skin alone, with only a fraction of players actually buying it. 

Hopefully we shall be heard!

Proposed solution/idea:

1. Maybe a slider next to the button that turns the Sona music on/off?  Default is mute, normal is mid way, want to lose my hearing is max? * It sounds great, but I am having to mess with all sorts of volume settings to be able to hear the music - and somehow, even tho the setting is like nothingness, all characters are yelling with the music setting as the only high.*

2. Could there be a check mark next to people's names when they are listening?  *I don't know, I realize that could lead to some strange in-fighting about why the Sona music isn't good enough for her teammates, but at the same time I would like to know if people are enjoying it!*

By the way, this skin is epic!!! I've only played it a few times so far, but the details are just absolutely astonishing!  But I agree with OP (and several other posters), it is hard to hear the music (and I would kind of like the ability to turn the music on/off for myself too).

1. Turn the in game music up.
2. Turn the other in game sounds down until it is at a level relative to the music you are happy with.
3. Out of game increase the volume of League of Legends relative to the other audio sources your computer is handling until the game sounds are at their previous level.
4. Enjoy your new, louder music.

There's no way that can be considered a long term fix... 

My in-game music is already at max settings...  I already turned down the other game's sound settings and turned up my PC's settings to accommodate for the reduced volume... except LoL isn't the ONLY thing I use my PC for so this fix can't be expected to be the long term solution to the issue...  Additionally.. if I'm playing anyone of the other 130 or so champs.. I have to go re-adjust all of those settings back to their previous configuration.  That's completely unacceptable.  There has to be some kind of bug.. I find it hard to believe that they would intentionally make her primary buying point the most frustrating part of the skin.

TL:DR - I already did that and it's an unacceptable fix. I use my PC for things other than LoL as well and shouldn't have to change all my settings each time I use the skin just so I can hear its music.  The volume has to be bugged... makes no sense that it's intentionally that low.

If you do it right you shouldn't have to change anything other than your base volume setting when you play or do something else.  Riot does not want audio to distract from the gameplay, so gameplay audio is given priority.  This has been their policy for a while now and it shouldn't be a surprise to anyone who knew of it ahead of time.  It is not a bug.

You're after a custom audio setting, and there are easy ways to achieve it WITHOUT causing problems with every other audio setting for everything else you do.

DJ Sona is a 3250 skin.. an Ultimate skin.  It's primary selling point is the music.  I'm not asking for a custom setting.. I'm saying that it's too low period.  If I go play any other video game and turn the music to same volume as the rest of the settings, you can hear the music fine still.  This skin doesn't reflect that scenario.  I have to turn all my game's sound volumes down dramatically to accommodate the low volume of this skin's music.  I don't have to do that in other games.

Riot seems to be advertising the music aspect of the skin.. Why would they advertise it like they did if they don't want you to be able to get down to the music?

I have ADHD and for me music actually helps me focus better.  The music is too low.  I can't properly enjoy it.. The fact the volume isn't high enough is more distracting than it being loud.

>  Riot does not want audio to distract from the gameplay

I think you missed this part.  It was is a very important part of my post.  Riot gave you the music at the level they think is best, however you have the ability to change it as you see fit.  I don't see why they would break their own policy on this just so players can avoid a few setting changes.

I feel like you didn't read my response.. it was primarily responding to that specific line.

There are other's having the same issue as me and can barely hear it.  I write music myself and I work on PC's for a living so I know how to adjust volumes.  I also understand how to balance volumes between different sources (which is a requirement for writing music..).  I'm not blindly complaining on the forums.  I've already did what I need on my end to improve the volumes, but it's not viable as a long term solution because I have to change the settings back when I'm NOT playing DJ Sona...

If you can barely hear the music when there are no game sounds there is a serious problem, and Riot will fix it shortly.  Not everyone is having this issue.

If you can barely hear the music over the top of the game sounds this is normal, and will require rebalancing of your audio levels to get to an acceptable level for your preference.

You may have actually been responding to that line, but you seemed to miss the point that Riot has a policy on this.  They don't make a policy just so they can ignore it.  Game sounds take priority over music and ambient audio.

2 of the 3 songs aren't ambient audio though.  Maybe it was just a poor developer choice.  I can't see the logic in the Kinetic and Concussive songs being so low.  Both of their styles resemble music that is generally played at a high enough volume to shake the walls... I'm not saying they should be THAT loud.. but they definitely need to be tweaked so they stand out more.

-edit- Let me also re-word something from one of my previous posts in this thread too.  I still think it's possibly a bug.  It is possible that MY sound isn't playing DJ Sona's music at the appropriate volume for some reason... Some people feel her music is loud (another person in the boards said it was loud w/ the setting at 60).  I'm having a hard time hearing the music with it set to 100 and other volumes lowered to accommodate.  It could very well be a bug.  The skin has only been on live since this morning.. ;x

I want to confirm this on me and my brothers computer I can understand it being tuned so we can hear the game but it's whisper quiet the only way to hear it is to turn everything else off and turn music to max. It's not even close to the games default music or I would be ok.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QpWLlspa,comment-id=000300060000,timestamp=2015-02-26T18:19:46.685+0000)
>
> Hey Kipster,
> 
> Do you have your music slider turned up in the audio options? 
> 
> I know a lot of people have the in-game music turned off because they have Pandora or the like when they play.


the music is super quiet compared with the normal ambient summoner's rift music. I had to turn my music setting on the client to 100 to hear it decently, I can hear the normal ambient music for rift clearly even at music set at 20 or so

I agree, the music is too quiet. I normally don't play with sound on because it bothers other people in the house. However, DJ sona doesn't bother anyone, not that anyone can hear it. I literally turned everything to like 10 and music to 100, maxed my comp's volume and that is still a bit quiet. 
Also using the excuse "we didn't want it to interfere with gameplay" is stupid. Not only can you turn off those options manually, but you can just turn off the sound altogether. Then I don't even think you can truly claim this hinders gameplay, there are visual cues for everything. Even looking at varus's q, sions/rek's ult; I could probably make the claim that hearing the abilities is a hindrance because it causes a subjective fear.
We payed $25 for a skin for a single champion, let us at least be able to control the best selling aspect of the skin or at least make it audible.

lmfao I knew this skin would turn out to be a rip off

And this coming from someone who enjoyed Spirit Guard Udyr even though I'd never played him before

Can't you turn the music up in the volume settings? I was pretty sure that was a thing. I tweak those things often. From default, I increased music volume, decreased ping volume, decreased effect volume. Does that not work for Sona's beats?
It shares the setting with Music, but even with music on max it is still so quiet, and then when you play another champ the summoner rift music is blaring.

Hello! I just want to start by saying I love the skin, and you guys did an awesome job making it! But like other posters have said, the music is a bit quiet. I totally understand not wanting to overwhelm the other sounds in game, but I do think the option of making it even just a bit louder would be nice. I mean, after all the work put into making the stellar music for the skin, wouldn't it be better to allow the theme of the skin to shine? Some people just blast music in the background or with their phones anyways.

It is somewhat possible to work around with adjusting the sound sliders, but that gets a tad tedious to change every time she's in game or not.

Again, fantastic work on the skin, Sona is my favorite champ, and I'm really excited she got this ultimate. Keep up the great work guys!

> [{quoted}](name=Crunkberri,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QpWLlspa,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-02-25T20:28:58.922+0000)
>
> I don't have the best hearing so that's what I thought the issue was... but then when I was actually playing, the other spell effects and such drowned out the music almost entirely.  I tried turning my in-game music to 100 and it was still incredibly difficult to hear.  I don't know if this is a bug or intended but I'm starting to regret my purchase.  The music was a huge part of the reason I bought the skin and I can barely hear it... 
> 
> I tried checking in the options for a DJ Sona specific volume bar but there doesn't appear to be one... 
> 
> Is there a problem with DJ Sona's music volume?  I would've thought I could hear it more clearly with the music setting adjusted to 100.

I had this in my first game as well, ethereal and concussive were really quiet, kinetic was OK.

Then the next game it was all fine so IDK
Are you on PBE? If so, then it is an easy fix. If not, I had no idea that she was already out :).
